results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) as a school reading in Poland:

## Status in Polish Education System

"Folwark zwierzęcy" należy także do uzupełniających lektur szkolnych w polskim systemie oświaty (Animal Farm is included as a supplementary reading in the Polish education system).

According to the search results from a school website, "Folwark zwierzęcy" by George Orwell is listed as a supplementary reading ("LEKTURA UZUPEŁNIAJĄCA") for grades VII-VIII.

## Historical Context in Polish Curriculum

In the curriculum changes, George Orwell's "Folwark zwierzęcy" was mentioned as one of the works that replaced another selection in the general literature section. The book appears to have been added to the curriculum along with C.S. Lewis's "Letters from a Senior to a Junior Devil."

## About the Book

"Folwark zwierzęcy" is a novel by English journalist and writer George Orwell, presenting farm animals that expelled humans and began to govern the farm themselves. It is an allegorical representation of Stalinism and a warning against any totalitarianism.

Until nearly the fall of the communist system in Poland in 1989, it was a novel banned by censorship - its first official domestic edition appeared only in 1988.

The search results confirm that "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) is currently part of the Polish school curriculum as a **supplementary reading** (lektura uzupełniająca), particularly for grades VII-VIII in primary school.
